intro: Echium alopecuroideum, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
